required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study To Evaluate The Effects Of Celecoxib (Celebrex®) Or Naproxen On Blood Pressure In Pediatric Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4, 6-week, Randomized Double Blind, Multicenter, Active-controlled Trial To Evaluate The Effects Of Celecoxib (Celebrex) Or Naproxen On Blood Pressure In Pediatric Subjects With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis.

brief_summary.textblock: This Is A Multicenter, Active-Controlled Trial To Evaluate The Effects Of Celecoxib (Celebrex®) Or Naproxen On Blood Pressure In Pediatric Subjects With Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 6/Final Visit
primary_outcome.description: Value at 6 weeks minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 2 in SBP.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 2 weeks minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SBP at Week 4.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 4 weeks minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 2.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 2 weeks minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 4.
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 4 weeks minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 6/Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Value at 6 weeks/Final Visit minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Parent's Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
secondary_outcome.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being 'very well' and 100 being 'very poor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With >= 30% Improvement in the Parent's Global Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
secondary_outcome.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being 'very well' and 100 being 'very poor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants, ≥8 years of age at the baseline, evaluated their own overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the VAS. The VAS ranges from 0 to 100, with 0 being 'very well' and 100 being 'very poor'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With >= 30% Improvement in the Participant's Global Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants, ≥8 years of age at the baseline, evaluated their own overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the VAS. The VAS ranges from 0 to 100, with 0 being 'very well' and 100 being 'very poor'.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Assessment of Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) for SBP and DBP at Week 6/Final Visit
other_outcome.description: Ambulatory BP measurements were obtained from 24 participants(in addition to the BP measurements obtained by the cuff technique) participating in the exploratory 24-hour ABPM sub-study. BP was monitored by a 24 hour Ambulatory BP device provided by a central vendor.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for Heart Rate at Week 6/Final Visit
other_outcome.description: Ambulatory BP measurements were obtained from 24 participants (in addition to the BP measurements obtained by the cuff technique) participating in the exploratory 24-hour ABPM sub-study. A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for SBP and DBP Pressure at Week 6/Final Visit (Sensitivity Analysis Excluding One Participant)
other_outcome.description: A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for SBP and DBP are presented in this Outcome Measure. One of the participant in the Naproxen ABPM Arm had clinically implausible high BP values at Baseline. Due to the low number of participants in each Arm (12 and 11) these values had a significant impact on the mean baseline values for the Naproxen Arm. As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for Heart Rate at Week 6/Final Visit (Sensitivity Analysis Excluding One Participant)
other_outcome.description: A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure. One of the participant in the Naproxen ABPM Arm had clinically implausible high BP values at Baseline. Due to the low number of participants in each Arm (12 and 11) these values had a significant impact on the mean baseline values for the Naproxen Arm. As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).

intervention.description: Celecoxib 50 mg or 100 mg PO BID for 6 weeks
Naproxen 7.5 mg/kg PO BID [maximum of 500 mg BID] for 6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Polyarticular (both rheumatoid factor positive and rheumatoid factor negative),oligoarticular and extended oligoarticular JIA for ≥3 months meeting the International League of Associations for Rheumatology (ILAR) criteria for Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA)
- Subjects with Systemic JIA with active arthritis in at least 1 joint but without active systemic features are eligible
- ≥2 years of age and <18 years of age prior to the Baseline visit
- Body weight ≥10 kg at the Baseline visit
- Candidate for chronic NSAID therapy in the Investigator's judgment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Psoriatic arthritis, enthesitis-related arthritis, and undifferentiated arthritis types of JIA
- Active systemic features over the prior 12 weeks in children with systemic Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA)
- Subjects with psoriatic arthritis, enthesitis-related arthritis, and undifferentiated arthritis should be excluded
- Subjects with active Systemic JIA should not be enrolled

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Juvenile Arthritis; Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis;Blood Pressure;Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a phase 4, 6-week, randomized double-blind, multicenter, active-controlled trial in participants with juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA). A total of 221 participants were screened into the study in 32 investigator sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 101 participants were randomized to treatment with Celecoxib and 100 participants to treatment with Naproxen. Of these randomized, 100 participants received treatment with Celecoxib and 98 participants received treatment with Naproxen. Three participants were randomized but did not receive any treatment.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 6/Final Visit
outcome.description: Value at 6 weeks minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP (blood pressure) measurements. For early terminations the last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used to impute missing data.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 6/Final Visit
measure.description: Value at 6 weeks minus value at baseline.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP (blood pressure) measurements. For early terminations the last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used to impute missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary analysis was based on 90% confidence interval (CI) for the difference across treatment groups (celecoxib – naproxen) in mean change from baseline in SBP. Change from Baseline in BP was analyzed using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) with model terms for treatment with baseline height, baseline weight, baseline age, and baseline SBP as covariates. No formal hypothesis testing was applied to the primary analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 2 in SBP.
outcome.description: Value at 2 weeks minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 2 in SBP.
measure.description: Value at 2 weeks minus value at baseline.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: For secondary analyses, 95% CIs for the differences across treatment groups (celecoxib – naproxen) in the mean change from baseline were generated. The change from baseline in BP was analyzed using an ANCOVA model with terms for treatment, baseline height, weight, age and baseline BP as covariates. Secondary analyses were conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in SBP at Week 4.
outcome.description: Value at 4 weeks minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in SBP at Week 4.
measure.description: Value at 4 weeks minus value at baseline.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: For secondary analyses, 95% CIs for the differences across treatment groups (celecoxib – naproxen) in the mean change from baseline were generated. The change from baseline in blood pressure was analyzed using an ANCOVA model with terms for treatment, baseline height, weight, age and baseline BP as covariates. Secondary analyses were conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

outcome.description: Value at 2 weeks minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

group.title: Naproxen

The change from baseline in BP was analyzed using an ANCOVA model with terms for treatment, baseline height, weight, age and baseline BP as covariates. outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 4.
measure.description: Value at 4 weeks minus value at baseline.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: For secondary analyses, 95% CIs for the differences across treatment groups (celecoxib – naproxen) in the mean change from baseline were generated. The change from baseline in BP was analyzed using an ANCOVA model with terms for treatment, baseline height, weight, age and baseline BP as covariates. Secondary analyses were conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 6/Final Visit
outcome.description: Value at 6 weeks/Final Visit minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 6/Final Visit
measure.description: Value at 6 weeks/Final Visit minus value at baseline.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Analysis set was used to analyze all BP measurements. For early terminations the LOCF was used to impute missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: For secondary analyses, 95% CIs for the differences across treatment groups (celecoxib – naproxen) in the mean change from baseline were generated. The change from baseline in BP was analyzed using an ANCOVA model with terms for treatment, baseline height, weight, age and baseline blood pressure as covariates. Secondary analyses were conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Parent's Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
outcome.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being ‘very well’ and 100 being ‘very poor.
outcome.population: Modified-Intent-to-Treat (MITT) Population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Parent's Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
measure.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being ‘very well’ and 100 being ‘very poor.
measure.population: Modified-Intent-to-Treat (MITT) Population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Change from Baseline to Week 6 was analyzed using ANCOVA model as well with treatment and Baseline value as a covariate. The LS mean change from Baseline was compared between treatment groups and an appropriate p-value and 95% CI for the difference between the two treatment groups was generated. This analysis was conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With >= 30% Improvement in the Parent’s Global Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
outcome.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being ‘very well’ and 100 being ‘very poor.
outcome.population: The MITT Population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Number of Participants With >= 30% Improvement in the Parent’s Global Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
measure.description: The parent/legal guardian evaluated the participant's overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS ranged from 0 to 100, with 0 being ‘very well’ and 100 being ‘very poor.
measure.population: The MITT Population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post-baseline efficacy measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: The number of subjects with at least a 30% improvement in Parent/Guardian's Global Assessment of Overall Well-Being was compared between the two treatment groups using a chi-square test. A 95% CI for the difference in incidence between groups was also computed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean Difference (Final Values) indicates difference in incidence (proportion) between treatments.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Overall Well-being at Week 6/Final Visit.
outcome.description: Participants, ≥8 years of age at the baseline, evaluated their own overall well-being at Baseline and at Week 6 (or Final Visit) by placing one vertical line on the VAS. The VAS ranges from 0 to 100, with 0 being ‘very well’ and 100 being ‘very poor’.
outcome.population: MITT population was used. Additional 3 participants aged <8 yrs at Baseline in Naproxen Arm provided self-assessments. In Celecoxib Arm, 2 participants (>=8 yrs) not provided self-assessment and 2 (>=8 yrs) provided but they were not from MITT and were excluded; additional 1 participant (<8 yrs) provided self-assessment and included in analysis.

The LS mean change from Baseline was compared between treatment groups and an appropriate p-value and 95% CI for the difference between the two treatment groups was generated. This analysis was conducted using a two-sided test with α=0.05.

group.title: Naproxen

analysis.groups_desc: The number of participants with at least a 30% improvement in participant's Global Assessment of Overall Well-Being was compared between the two treatment groups using a chi-square test. A 95% CI for the difference in incidence between groups was also computed.
analysis.estimate_desc: Mean Difference (Final Values) indicates difference in incidence (proportion) between treatments.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Assessment of Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) for SBP and DBP at Week 6/Final Visit
outcome.description: Ambulatory BP measurements were obtained from 24 participants(in addition to the BP measurements obtained by the cuff technique) participating in the exploratory 24-hour ABPM sub-study. BP was monitored by a 24 hour Ambulatory BP device provided by a central vendor.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. For one participant in Naproxen Arm the device failed to collect 11 out of 24 readings at Week 6 and this participant was not included in analysis. ABPM data were analyzed for 12 and 11 participants in Celecoxib and Naproxen Arms respectively.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen

outcome.description: Ambulatory BP measurements were obtained from 24 participants (in addition to the BP measurements obtained by the cuff technique) participating in the exploratory 24-hour ABPM sub-study. A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure.
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. For one participant in Naproxen Arm the device failed to collect 11 out of 24 readings at Week 6 and this participant was not included in analysis. ABPM data were analyzed for 12 and 11 participants in Celecoxib and Naproxen Arms respectively.

measure.description: Ambulatory BP measurements were obtained from 24 participants (in addition to the BP measurements obtained by the cuff technique) participating in the exploratory 24-hour ABPM sub-study. A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure.
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. For one participant in Naproxen Arm the device failed to collect 11 out of 24 readings at Week 6 and this participant was not included in analysis. ABPM data were analyzed for 12 and 11 participants in Celecoxib and Naproxen Arms respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for SBP and DBP Pressure at Week 6/Final Visit (Sensitivity Analysis Excluding One Participant)
outcome.description: A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for SBP and DBP are presented in this Outcome Measure. One of the participant in the Naproxen ABPM Arm had clinically implausible high BP values at Baseline. Due to the low number of participants in each Arm (12 and 11) these values had a significant impact on the mean baseline values for the Naproxen Arm. As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. A total of 22 out of 24 participants were analyzed in this sensitivity analysis. Two participants were excluded, one due to outlying BP values at Baseline and another due to the device failure to collect 11 out of 24 readings).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. A total of 22 out of 24 participants were analyzed in this sensitivity analysis. Two participants were excluded, one due to outlying BP values at Baseline and another due to the device failure to collect 11 out of 24 readings).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for Heart Rate at Week 6/Final Visit (Sensitivity Analysis Excluding One Participant)
outcome.description: A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure. One of the participant in the Naproxen ABPM Arm had clinically implausible high BP values at Baseline. Due to the low number of participants in each Arm (12 and 11) these values had a significant impact on the mean baseline values for the Naproxen Arm. As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).
outcome.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. A total of 22 out of 24 participants were analyzed in this sensitivity analysis. Two participants were excluded, one due to outlying BP values at Baseline and another due to the device failure to collect 11 out of 24 readings).

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Assessment of ABPM for Heart Rate at Week 6/Final Visit (Sensitivity Analysis Excluding One Participant)
measure.description: A summary of ABPM 24-hour averages for heart rate is presented in this Outcome Measure. One of the participant in the Naproxen ABPM Arm had clinically implausible high BP values at Baseline. Due to the low number of participants in each Arm (12 and 11) these values had a significant impact on the mean baseline values for the Naproxen Arm. As a result, an additional sensitivity analysis was conducted, excluding this participant (Participant ID 10031002).
measure.population: Safety population included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication. A total of 22 out of 24 participants were analyzed in this sensitivity analysis. Two participants were excluded, one due to outlying BP values at Baseline and another due to the device failure to collect 11 out of 24 readings).

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Celecoxib
group.description: Participants received celecoxib capsules 50 mg twice daily (BID) or 100 mg BID for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

group.title: Naproxen
group.description: Participants received naproxen suspension 7.5 mg/kg BID (maximum dose of 500 mg BID) for 6 weeks. The volume/dose of the study medications was determined by the subject’s weight at Baseline visit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
